title: Photos: Firefighters contain a quarter of huge California-Nevada wildfire
description: Smoke blotted out the sun on the Las Vegas Strip, while flames scorched tens of thousands of hectares of desert scrub.

title: Trump charged in federal election probe, his third criminal indictment
description: A grand jury has charged the Republican leader with witness tampering, conspiracy, in attempt to undo election loss.

title: ‘Black suffering’: Henrietta Lacks medical research lawsuit settled in US
description: Cells taken in 1951 from Lacks, a Black woman, without her knowledge became the cornerstone of modern medical research.

title: Will talks between US officials and Taliban leaders bring Afghans hope?
description: Parties hold first face-to-face discussions since group retook power in Afghanistan in 2021.

title: Meta takes steps to end news access in Canada over law on paying publishers
description: A new law forces platforms like Google and Meta to negotiate commercial deals with Canadian news firms for content.

title: Hezbollah chief urges halt to Palestinian camp clashes in Lebanon
description: Nasrallah warns of 'repercussions' of ongoing clashes in Ein el-Hilweh, the largest Palestinian refugee camp in Lebanon.

title: Former British colonies renew calls for reparations on Emancipation Day
description: Countries such as Jamaica and Barbados commemorate 200 years since the end of slavery with calls for action and healing.

title: Suspected AQAP attack in Yemen kills 5 with links to secessionists
description: Four Southern Armed Forces fighters also injured in Wadi Omran in Abyan province in attack early Tuesday.

title: ‘Hopeful but sceptical’: Colombia prepares for ceasefire with ELN rebels
description: Ceasefire coming into force this week marks victory for President Gustavo Petro, but 'total peace' push faces hurdles.

title: Kenya considers leading a force in Haiti: What you need to know
description: Support for foreign intervention in crisis-racked Haiti has grown, but civil society groups warn of past abuses.

title: Shooting at Swedish consulate in Turkey’s Izmir injures one
description: Turkish staff member seriously wounded, attacker is Turkish citizen says governor's office.

title: UAE promises to allow climate protests at COP28
description: Official permission is required for protests in the Gulf nation, which is hosting UN climate talks this year.

title: Palestinian shot dead after six Israelis wounded in illegal settlement
description: Palestinian health ministry identifies suspect in shooting attack as Mohannad al-Mazraa, 20, from nearby West Bank town.

title: Mozambique President Nyusi claims immunity in $2bn ‘tuna bond’ case
description: The claim against Nyusi focuses on $11m payments shipbuilder Privinvest allegedly made in 2014 to fund his election run.

title: Uranium price hike projected after Niger coup spurs slight rise
description: Mining operations continue in Niger, world's seventh largest producer of uranium, despite last week's military takeover.

title: EU sees no uranium supply risks to nuclear production after Niger coup
description: Niger has some of the world’s most extensive deposits of uranium, a key ingredient in the nuclear industry.

title: US blacklists two Chinese firms over Uighur forced labour accusations
description: US says sanctions aim to 'promote accountability for ongoing genocide, crimes against humanity' in China's Xinjiang.

title: Deadly train shooting in India: What to know
description: Indian railway security guard allegedly killed four people on board express train before being apprehended by police.

title: Russia responsible for Niger coup, says top Ukrainian official
description: The Russian Wagner Group's boss, Yevgeny Prigozhin, has hailed the coup as a move towards independence from the West.

title: Timeline: A history of ECOWAS military interventions in three decades
description: The West African bloc has a history of successful military interventions to restore constitutional order in the region.

title: England hammer China 6-1 to ease into last 16 of Women’s World Cup
description: England top the group to set up a Round of 16 World Cup clash with Nigeria, while Denmark qualify in second place.

title: At least 17 die after crane collapses at India highway construction site
description: The accident in the Thane region of Maharashtra state killed five engineers and 12 labourers.

title: Sweden rules out sweeping changes to free speech law amid Quran burnings
description: Sweden and Denmark have seen a string of protests in recent weeks in which copies of the Quran were burned.

title: At long last, there is real hope for peace in Yemen
description: The international community owes it to Yemenis to not let the current momentum go the way of previous flurries of hope.

title: UK recognises ‘acts of genocide’ against Yazidis by ISIL
description: In the Sinjar region of Iraq in 2014, ISIL fighters systematically killed and enslaved thousands of men and women.

title: Infographic: Breastfeeding benefits and challenges
description: On World Breastfeeding Week, we take a look at why breast milk is important and where breastfeeding is most prevalent.

title: China zoo denies rare sun bear is a human in costume
description: Hangzhou Zoo denies suggestion bear might be a person in a costume after footage of standing animal prompts rumours.

title: Imam killed after Hindu mob attacks mosque in India’s Gurugram
description: Maulana Saad, 19, killed inside the mosque hours after deadly communal violence in neighbouring district, officials say.

title: A test of wills: Can ECOWAS reverse Niger coup and establish a new order?
description: Niger coup presents a diplomatic dilemma for the West African bloc whose new leadership is keen to entrench a new order.

title: Deadly rains batter northern China in aftermath of storm Doksuri
description: At least 11 are dead and 27 missing after days of rain lash Beijing and nearby cities in wake of storm Doksuri.

title: UK house prices drop by most since 2009 amid rising interest rates
description: The average house price in July was down 3.8 percent compared with July last year, mortgage lender Nationwide says.

title: USA survive scare against Portugal to reach Women’s World Cup last 16
description: Women's World Cup champions squeak through into knockout stages after 0-0 draw with Portugal as Dutch top Group E.

title: France to begin evacuation for its citizens, EU nationals in Niger
description: The French foreign ministry says evacuation plans were already under way for European nationals living in Niger.

title: Meta developing AI chatbot with personality of Abraham Lincoln, report says
description: Tech giant is preparing to launch chatbots with distinct personas as soon as next month, Financial Times says.

title: Myanmar’s Aung San Suu Kyi granted clemency: Reports
description: Ex-leader receives a pardon in five of the 19 cases against her and will remain under house arrest, media reports say.

title: I hate US sports. The women’s football team is making it more difficult
description: From taking on systemic racism to winning the battle for equal pay, the USWNT is an inspiration American girls need.

title: Australian charged with sexually abusing 91 girls at childcare centres
description: Australian authorities charged45-year-old man with 1,623 separate offences against children.

title: Can Doctor AI predict cancer, save lives?
description: There’s mounting evidence that it can but ethical and logistical questions still cloud AI’s medical future.

title: US mother sentenced to life for killing her two kids in ‘doomsday’ plot
description: Idaho woman Lori Vallow claimed to be a goddess tasked with ushering in the second coming of Jesus Christ.

title: Russian forces down new wave of drones over Moscow, office tower hit
description: Mayor says the office building damaged was the same one hit in an attack on Sunday.

title: Myanmar military extends emergency, postpones election
description: Military delays election it promised to hold in August 2023 citing ongoing violence across the country.

title: Two killed in Senegal in protests over arrest of opposition figure Sonko
description: West African country's interior ministry says it is taking measures to 'preserve peace and tranquillity in the country'.

title: Taliban, US hold first official talks since Afghanistan takeover
description: Two-day talks in Qatar's capital focused on economy, human rights and narcotics trafficking, officials say.

title: Burkina Faso and Mali warn against foreign intervention after Niger coup
description: The two countries joined Guinea in expressing 'fraternal solidarity' with the people of Niger after a military coup.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 524
description: These are the main developments as the Russian invasion of Ukraine enters its 524th day.
